page.title: 14Landscape
page.content: The Grand Union canal which passes through Linslade is one of the most important and interesting of all canals in Britain. The Grand Union Canal Society was founded in the mid sixties to seek conservation of the canal when it was threatened with closure. The Society maintains a close interest in life on the waterway as well as a watching brief over threats to the fabric of the canal and adjacent buildings. Of particular concern are long term structural failures again threatening the very future of the canal and the preservation of the essential character of the Grand Union canal. In this area it traverses a surprising amount of very peaceful and delightful rural countryside. It is hoped to make the canal a National Park linking London to other centres of population.
